benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/product - Retrieve product for a given subscription and date

covered: Valid Request: Happy paths covered (both subscriptionId and requestedDate; subscriptionId only/backward compatibility).
Empty Response/No Data: Not-found and no-data paths covered (nonexistent subscription, empty DB, date before start).
Query Parameters: Broad combinations and validation covered (missing params, extra params, invalid UUID, invalid date).
Server/Dependency Failures: Service down (503) and downstream failure (502/503) covered.
Response Contract: application/json Content-Type checked; Product schema validated against catalog; correctness on boundary date regression.
Security Hardening: Negative inputs (SQL injection, XSS) assert safe handling and no sensitive leakage.
Performance/Load: Basic performance threshold and concurrent requests under load validated.
Pagination: Not applicable to a single-resource lookup endpoint (no list to paginate).
gaps: Caching Behavior: No scenarios validating ETag/If-None-Match, Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since, or Cache-Control/Expires headers and 304 Not Modified flow.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for 429 Too Many Requests, rate-limit headers, or backoff (Retry-After).
Ambiguous Expectations: Several scenarios have non-deterministic outcomes (TC03, TC04, TC12, TC14: “200 or error”), which weakens acceptance criteria and automation value.
Authorization Depth: No scenario for 403 Forbidden (valid token but insufficient permissions) if RBAC/entitlements apply.
Time/Date Edge Cases: No tests for timezone handling, DST/UTC boundaries, or invalid-but-well-formed dates (e.g., 2024-02-30).
Error Contract: Error responses are checked for messages, but no validation against a standard error schema (fields like code, message, type, context).
recommendations: Add caching tests: verify Cache-Control directives, ETag/If-None-Match and Last-Modified/If-Modified-Since behavior, including 304 responses for unchanged resources.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate bursts to trigger 429, assert rate-limit and Retry-After headers; verify normal requests remain unaffected.
Resolve ambiguity: Make TC03, TC04, TC12, TC14 deterministic per business rules; split into explicit success or error scenarios with exact status codes.
Extend authorization coverage: if RBAC exists, add a 403 scenario (valid token lacking permission) and confirm no overexposure of data.
Add date/time robustness: test timezone-aware dates, boundary times (start/end of day), DST transitions, and invalid-but-well-formed dates.
Validate a consistent error schema: assert presence and formats of error fields (e.g., code, message, type); ensure no stack traces or internals are leaked.
Tighten response validation: assert specific Product fields and alignment with catalog version on the requested date (expand on TC22).
Clarify behavior for missing parameters: define whether zero or one parameter is allowed; enforce with precise tests and status codes.
